channel.title: Managing Hypertension & Diabetes on Slice325 Learn
channel.description: Recent content in Managing Hypertension & Diabetes on Slice325 Learn

item.title: Course Objectives
item.description:
Course Objectives

â€¢ Educate clients with hypertension and diabetes on the importance of diet and nutrition The primary objective of this course is to educate clients with hypertension and diabetes on the crucial role that diet, and nutrition play in managing their conditions. By understanding the specific nutrient needs and dietary recommendations for each condition, clients can make informed choices about their food intake and develop healthy eating habits. This knowledge will empower clients to take control of their health and make lifestyle changes that contribute to better management of hypertension and diabetes.

item.title: Course Outlines
item.description:
COURSE OUTLINE

![Alt text](Managing Hypertension & Diabetes Preventing Falls Course.pdf-image-009.jpg)

Section I: Introduction

The course will cover various topics, including understanding hypertension and diabetes, nutrition and diet recommendations, fall prevention strategies, lifestyle changes, medications, and evaluation methods to ensure a comprehensive understanding of managing these conditions.

Key Lessons:

  • Overview of the course
  • Importance of diet and nutrition
  • Risk factors for falls

Section II: Understanding Hypertension and Diabetes

Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a condition where the force of the blood against the walls of the arteries is consistently too high. Diabetes is a chronic disease characterized by high blood glucose levels due to either insufficient insulin production or the body’s inability to use insulin effectively. Both conditions can lead to severe complications and increase the risk of falls if not managed properly.
